participant_abstract.sent: Marketing expert, ID, UID gave their respective presentations corresponding to the concept phase of the remote design.
The gist of my presentation was that we had to make some concrete decisions regarding materials as provided by our current manufacturer.
The marketing expert brought in some more marketing insight, mainly that voice recognition technology is hot stuff and also that "squishy" and "earthy" are in.

participant_decisions.sent: to go with voice recognition technology (for simple functions) as opposed to touch screen technology.
To go with "squishy" feel (meaning that we will use much rubber in the construciton of the remote) and "earthy" colors/design.

The "non-remote remote" shape and feel. still we will go with a simple design, the remote will be able to sit on a coffee table, for example, and look nice. non-primary functions will be hidden behind a slidable panel.

participant_problems.sent: Some things still don't seem concrete (e.g., what shape the buttons will take).
Basically i'm not sure whether we are on track as far as the specificity of the remote is concerned.
